item.Name: always draw sky!#always draw sky 0, even if no +sky polygons are visible
don't strip pathfinding#always leave pathfinding in, even for a multiplayer scenario
big vehicle use center point for light sampling!
in space#so we can hide hud elements like the compass
survival#so we can strip the elite from the global player representations
do not strip variants#so we can test the impact of variant stripping

_field_string_id.name: map name#Used to associate external resources with this map - e.g. PDA camera setting block names.

_field_tag_reference.name: Scenario sound bank Number 2#Another scenario-specific sound bank. All will be loaded.
Scenario sound bank Number 3#Another scenario-specific sound bank. All will be loaded.
Scenario sound bank Number 4#Another scenario-specific sound bank. All will be loaded.

_field_string_id.name: Inside reverb name#This reverb will be used for inside areas when the listener is outside.

_field_real.name: local sea level:wu#used to calculate aircraft altitude

_field_real_point_3d.name: sandbox origin point#forge coordinates are relative to this point

_field_string_id.name: default vehicle set#when vehicle set is "map default," this vehicle set is used

_field_block.name: structure bsps
_field_block._field_explanation: Tells lightmapper desired res for structure bitmaps. Numbers in parens are final sizes after compression

_field_real.name: structure vertex sink#this is the most that we can sink a soft surface link snow in the structure_bsp via vertex painting.

item.Name: ray trace adjacent bsps on sky hits
lightmaps final gather ignores backfacing hits
not a normally playable space in an MP map (check this on shared BSPs)
dont use extra lighting bsps for cubemaps

_field_real.name: max shadow count scale#scale up or down the max number of shadows as set in the throttle tag per bsp
decorator sunlight minimum:[0.0 to 1.0]#0.0 means allow fully dark in the shadows, higher values will brighten up the shadowed decorators

item.Name: enable volumetric light shafts for this BSP

_field_real.name: sun direction offset#if we want to slide the frustum up closer to the sun so that not as much of the frustum is below the ground
sun direction offset#if we want to slide the frustum up closer to the sun so that not as much of the frustum is below the ground
sun direction offset#if we want to slide the frustum up closer to the sun so that not as much of the frustum is below the ground
sun direction offset#if we want to slide the frustum up closer to the sun so that not as much of the frustum is below the ground

_field_block._field_explanation: Describes which other bsps are physical 'clones' of this bsp This is used to determine how to attach 'position-only' elements, like decorators, to the bsps: Each clone gets a separate copy of decorators that are in both. Non-cloned bsps cannot split decorators this way - the decorator will be given to the lowest numbered bsp
relative to world unit per texel. default: 1-> 1 2-> 4 2-> 16 3-> 64 5-> 128 6-> 256 7-> 512

item.Name: analytical bounce uses per bsp setting

_field_real.name: analytical light bounce modifier (when per bsp flag is on)
non analytical light bounce modifier (when per bsp flag is on)

_field_long_block_flags.name: extra lighting bsp flags#neighbor bsp that occlude or contribute light (including bounce light)

_field_real.name: custom gravity scale#0==nogravity, 1==full, set the custom gravity scale flag to make this parameter active
cloud scale#mapping to the world unit

_field_block.name: game portal to door occluder mapping

_field_real_point_3d.name: world bounds min#Physics world will include this min point
world bounds max#Physics world will include this max point

_field_tag_reference.name: cinematic soundbank#only for cinematics. If you try to use this for anything else without talking to me, i will stab you in the face

_field_real_rgb_color.name: sky clear color#linear color, must check override flag above to use

item.Name: scripted#the level script will set this value; the other settings here will be ignored.
invert#result of function is one minus actual result
always active#function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

_field_real.name: period:seconds#this is the period for the above function (lower values make the function oscillate quickly, higher values make it oscillate slowly)

_field_short_block_index.name: scale period by#multiply this function by the above period
scale function by#multiply this function by the result of the above function

_field_short_enum.name: wobble function#the curve used for the wobble

_field_real.name: wobble period:seconds#the length of time it takes for the magnitude of this function to complete a wobble
wobble magnitude:percent#the amount of random wobble in the magnitude

_field_real_fraction.name: square wave threshold#if non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave.

_field_short_integer.name: step count#the number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00)
sawtooth count#the number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0

_field_short_block_index.name: scale result by#multiply this function (from a weapon, vehicle, etc.) final result of all of the above math

_field_short_enum.name: bounds mode#controls how the bounds, below, are used

_field_short_block_index.name: turn off with#if the specified function is off, so is this function

_field_block.name: scenery

_field_short_block_index.name: parent object#if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

_field_block._field_explanation: these settings vary how the sound fades as you move closer or further away from it.

_field_real.name: don't obstruct distance:world units#don't obstruct below this distance
don't play distance:world units#don't play below this distance
attack distance:world units#start playing at full volume at this distance
minimum distance:world units#start attenuating at this distance
sustain begin distance:world units#set attenuation to sustain db at this distance
sustain end distance:world units#continue attenuating to silence at this distance
maximum distance:world units#the distance beyond which this sound is no longer audible
sustain db:dB#the amount of attenuation between sustain begin and end

item.Name: hidden#this palette is only visible in superforge, and objects within it are only editable in superforge

_field_long_integer.name: maximum allowed#if this is <= 0, these are 'unlimited' (up to a reasonable code-defined maximum)

_field_block.name: Playtest req palette#requisition for SvE, activated via an init.txt option for playtest balance
_field_block._field_explanation: If you want the award to be a custom app, point at globals/custom_app_globals, and match one of the names from that tag for "display_name"

_field_long_enum.name: Submenu#controls which requisition submenu this object should appear in

_field_long_integer.name: maximum allowed#cant buy more if there are too many in play

_field_long_flags.name: built-in palettes for which item is enabled by default

_field_long_integer.name: starting ammo#1..100 for ammoless weapons, 0 = default for all weapons

_field_real.name: warm-up time:seconds#item will be unavailable until x seconds into the scenario
price increase factor#price = original-price x increase-factor to-the n_times_bought

_field_block.name: trigger volumes
_field_block._field_explanation: the name of the trigger volume specifies what kind of volume it is: 'zone_set:' 'begin_zone_set:' 'kill' (plus '_soft' for soft kill volume) 'playerkill' (plus '_soft' for soft kill volume) for player only kill volume 'safe_zone' (plus '_soft' for soft kill volume) 'location_' 'ordnance_bounds' 'unsafe_spawn' append ':*' to zone set names to allow vehicles to teleport along with their players.

_field_real.name: z sink#this is only valid for sector type trigger volumes

plugin._field_explanation: You can use the following to override multiplayer global spawn influencers for the scenario. Default settings are defined in multiplayer/multiplayer_globals.multiplayer_globals.

item.Name: force planar#force decal to be 2 triangle quad. does not clip to geometry

_field_long_integer.name: largest zoneset static decal memory size:kilobytes#this is memory for the largest possible zoneset - default (0) is 2048

_field_real.name: decal depth bias override (USE WITH CAUTION)#you should not need to do this -- this is for a mission with strange collision geo

_field_pad.name: soon to be an initial task

_field_real.name: initial movement distance#before doing anything else, the actor will travel the given distance in its forward direction
delay:seconds#how long the AI should pause at this point
angle:degrees#the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

_field_short_integer.name: swarm count#number of cretures in swarm if a swarm is spawned at this location

_field_real.name: initial movement distance#before doing anything else, the actor will travel the given distance in its forward direction
delay:seconds#how long the AI should pause at this point
angle:degrees#the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

_field_long_enum.name: wave placement filter#Filter which squads in Firefight waves can be spawned into this squad

_field_block.name: cells
_field_block._field_explanation: Specify the distribution of characters and weapons in the cell sub-folders

_field_short_integer.name: normal diff count#initial number of actors on normal difficulty

_field_real.name: delay:seconds#how long the AI should pause at this point
angle:degrees#the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

_field_block.name: cells
_field_block._field_explanation: Specify the distribution of characters and weapons in the cell sub-folders

_field_short_integer.name: normal diff count#initial number of actors on normal difficulty

_field_real.name: delay:seconds#how long the AI should pause at this point
angle:degrees#the angle-from-forward that the AI can pick at this point

_field_block.name: firing positions
_field_block._field_explanation: Ctrl-N: Creates a new area and assigns it to the current selection of firing points.

_field_real.name: hold time{occupy time}:seconds#How long the AI should pause at this point before searching
search time:seconds#How long the AI should search at this point before returning
pause time:seconds#How long the AI should pause at this point after searching before moving on
cooldown time:seconds#How long after being abandoned should this point be available again

_field_block.name: full cues{cues}
_field_block._field_explanation: The following blocks describe who will receive this cue.
The following blocks describe the type of stimulus and related payload; you should only specify one.

_field_block.name: navmesh areas
_field_block._field_explanation: This controls the amount of simplification applied to internal segments and convex boundary segments
When simplifying internal segments and convex boundary segments, this controls the maximum projected distance by which the simplified segment can deviate from the unsimplified segment
This controls the amount of simplification applied to concave boundary segments
Maximum slope AI will traverse (degrees). Don't touch unless necessary.
Faces will only be merged if the cosine of the angle between their normals is greater than this.
Holes with area less than this are candidates for conversion to quads
The maximum number of faces that can be included in a partition. Basically, don't change this.
The area of any partition loop will not be reduced by more than this fraction

_field_char_integer.name: mopp build type!*#they say it only matters for ps3

_field_short_enum.name: dialogue type#when this ending is triggered, launch a dialogue event of the given type
dialogue type#when this ending is triggered, launch a dialogue event of the given type

item.Name: If ALL players in trigger volume
Player shot more than X seconds ago

_field_tag_reference.name: weather sound#plays when rain is active, weather rate gets applied to scale.
entry sound#plays when entering this area
exit sound#plays when leaving this area

item.Name: use adjacent cluster as portal scale
use adjacent cluster as exterior scale

_field_tag_reference.name: cluster camera_fx tag:if empty, uses default#if empty, uses default

_field_real.name: forced exposure:stops#the target exposure (ONLY USED WHEN FORCE EXPOSURE IS CHECKED)
forced auto-exposure screen brightness:[0.0001-1]#how bright you want the screen to be (ONLY USED WHEN FORCE AUTO EXPOSURE IS CHECKED)

_field_block.name: crates

_field_short_block_index.name: parent object#if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

_field_real.name: Directional Acceleration Mult. #Multiplier applied to all phantoms' direction acceleration factors. Used to scale man-cannon strength.

_field_block._field_explanation: object data for multiplayer game use

_field_short_block_index.name: parent object#if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

_field_real.name: ecology margin:wus#distance from ecology boundary that creature begins to be repulsed
weight#probability of producing at this source
max destination volume penetration:wu#The farthest the boid will go inside our destination volume

_field_real_bounds.name: production frequency bounds:boids/sec#How frequently boids are produced at one of the sources (limited by the max boid count)

_field_real.name: source scale to 0 radius:wus#Distance from a source at which the creature scales to full size
sink scale to 0 radius:wus#Distance from a sink at which the creature begins to scale to zero
flock destroy duration:sec#The number of seconds it takes to kill all units in the flock if it gets destroyed

_field_short_block_index.name: parent object#if an object with this name exists, we attach to it as a child

_field_real.name: Directional Acceleration Mult. #Multiplier applied to all phantoms' direction acceleration factors. Used to scale man-cannon strength.

_field_tag_reference.name: global screen effect#ignores the falloff curves
atmosphere globals#settings that apply to the entire scenario

_field_block.name: tasks*!

_field_real.name: follow Z clamp:wus#Don't follow at areas outside of this vertical margin
maximum duration:seconds#Exhaust this task after it has been active for this long
exhaustion delay:seconds#When a task exhausts, hold actors in the task for this long before releasing them

_field_string_id.name: Exhaustion Script#static script that is run when the task is exhausted

_field_short_enum.name: dialogue type#when someone enters this task for the first time, they play this type of dialogue

_field_short_integer.name: Kungfu count#The number of guys under this task that should be allowed to fight the player at a time

_field_block._field_explanation: You don't need to modify these here. They are managed by the objectives ui

_field_short_integer.name: lifetime count#task will never want to suck in more then n guys over lifetime (soft ceiling only applied when limit exceeded
max body count#task becomes inactive after the given number of casualties

_field_real.name: min strength:[0,1]#task becomes inactive after the strength of the participants falls below the given level

_field_block.name: decorators

_field_real.name: move distance#drop height for drop to ground
angle snap interval#rotate brushes will snap to intervals of this
Editor cull distance#decorators will not draw beyond this distance from the camera

_field_block._field_explanation: [] brush size -= brush feathering 0-9 brush opacity SHIFT+0-9 select palette SHIFT while painting will reverse the operation

_field_real.name: time#if you finish in under this time you get the following bonus

_field_block.name: cubemaps
_field_block._field_explanation: empty masks mean automatic selection.

_field_string_id.name: script name#The name of a custom script used to drive the performance. If none is given, a default script is uses that goes through the lines in sequence
global name#The name of a script global that will be declared for this performance.

_field_long_string.name: fragment#maximum 256 characters, type just branch condition (with brackets) in case of branches
branch target#the script to branch to (with any arguments to it). Used only if type is branch

_field_long_integer.name: transition frame count#The number of frames from the end of the animation to start transitioning out

_field_real.name: thespian radius{performance radius}#The radius inside which actors have to be in order to start.
attraction radius#The radius inside which actors become attracted to the thespian origin.

_field_real_fraction.name: attraction probability per second:[0,1]#The probability that an actor be attracted once inside the thespian radius, every second.

_field_tag_reference.name: type
_field_tag_reference.validtags: bipd, char, bloc, mach, scen, vehi

_field_tag_reference.name: type
_field_tag_reference.validtags: bipd, char, bloc, mach, scen, vehi

plugin._field_explanation: specify zero for values that should use the data in the globals tag.

_field_block.name: garbage collection
_field_block._field_explanation: time before the game considers that following entities as garbage

_field_long_integer.name: Max dead body count #above this number, overloaded mp time is used to garbage collect dead bodies

_field_tag_reference.name: hud screen reference#appears for the player through the scenario

plugin._field_explanation: Drops randomly selected set of ordnance at positions marked by drop_point objects.

_field_tag_reference.name: drop pod (scenery)#if set, overrides that in progression globals

_field_long_integer.name: Ordnance max active count#zero means unlimited

_field_real.name: Initial drop delay:seconds#from start of play til fanfare begins

_field_string.name: Normal drop name:blank string will match all sets

item.Name: initial drop#will be used for initial drops
player drop#will be used for personal drops
random drop#will be used for random drops
objective drop#will be used for objective-based drops

_field_block.name: Exit load screen#for non-mainmenu, we always use the first one

_field_real.name: Tint Gradient Lookup V Coordinate#Value between 0.0 and 1.0 determines which line to use for tint. A negative value will choose a random tint from the palette.
